noun.description: A thing that is granted, especially in response to demands; a thing conceded.
examples: the strikers returned to work having won some concessions

noun.description: A preferential allowance or rate given by an organization.
The right to use land or other property for a specified purpose, granted by a government, company, or other controlling body.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin concessio(n-), from the verb concedere (see concede).
